place.name: DORRINGTON
place.gazetteerText: DORRINGTON, a parish in Sleaford district, Lincoln; 5 miles N of Sleaford town and r. station. It has a post office under Sleaford. Acres, 680. Real property, £2, 758. Pop., 467. Houses, 102. The property is divided among a few. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £120. Patron, Lord Aveland. The church is ancient, and has early Norman windows. Charities, £46. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
